item.title: Report X-2023120335
item.description:
Report X-2023120335

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The hazmat box was put into overhead sortation. One of the jugs in the box was crushed in, forcing contents to leak out from under the cap. The cap felt to be on tight. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Flammable liquid hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Betco advanced alcohol gel sanitizer 1-gallon had loose lid resulted to leakage. DescribePack: Bottle had loose lid resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120366
item.description:
Report X-2023120366

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120366 SequenceEvent: Pkg. received from driver after they noticed pkg. was wet, pkg. received from 389-OLIV-A. Pkg. taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: It was noted after inspecting contents, one of the containers had a loose cap, causing liquid to leak out. The shipper does not provide protective material inside box to protect the caps if the pkg. is dropped. This is not the first time we have encounter damages on these items, same shipper. Orientation arrows on pkg. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in the HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH. 2. X-2023120368 SequenceEvent: Pkg. was remove from van after it was noted by loader, that pkg. was wet. Pkg. taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting contents, it was noted that 1 of the containers had a loose cap, causing liquid to leak out. There were no protective material in box to protect caps. Orientation arrows present. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. siting in the HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH. 3. X-2023120369 SequenceEvent: Pkg. received off trailer 821657, wet, pkg. found lying on its side. Pkg. taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: It was noted that 2 containers had loose caps causing liquid to leak out. There was no protective material in pkg. to protect the caps. Orientation arrows present on side of box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in the HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH. 4. X-2023120370 SequenceEvent: pkg. received off trailer 821657, wet. Pkg. taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting contents, it was note that both containers had loose caps, causing liquid to leak out from each. There were no protective material inside both pkgs. Orientation arrows present on side of pkg. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: pkg. sitting in HMPA awaiting further inspection from PGH.

  • Description: 1. X-2023120351 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One of the jugs in the box was cracked along the seam under the handle, causing contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote. 2. X-2023120354 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: 2 jugs in the box were both cracked along the seams behind the jugs' handles, causing their contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120407
item.description:
Report X-2023120407

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: PANAMA CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by evening QA member, as they were unloading a truck that had gone out for delivery, they secured a black tote and brought it to the QA cage for inspection. Personnel at the time felt unsure on proper handling and moved the package to a holding cage for AM QA team to properly deal with. Package was then moved to the HazMat Cage for proper holding and inspection. DescribePack: Package does not show any major failure points, lids on package were seemingly tight, and package appeared to have leaked at the top of the box going downward on a peculiar side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package did not show any further indication of a leak, however it was kept inside the black tote for monitoring overnight, when we arrived there was no additional liquid beyond what was absorbed into the box.

item.title: Report X-2023120404
item.description:
Report X-2023120404

  • City: WEST PALM BEACH

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found inside of a chute connected to the conveyor belt. when discovered the package was placed inside of a red hazmat bin and the damaged hazmat package process was started. DescribePack: 2 out of the 4 bottles of coil cleaner had loose caps which caused the liquid contents to leak out of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottles of liquid were placed inside of a red hazmat bin in the upright position to stop the release of the liquids.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of Super Trump detergent for machine warewashing are cracked and leaked about 20 ounces. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival, the wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.description:
Report E-2023120215

  • City: SARASOTA

  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was delivering using a CoAx fitting when product backed up into the hose. He shut everything down & opened the ear of the fitting, which emptied the hose. He started flow again & it backed up. He THEN wedged the cap in the rear VR tube, over the hose tray, to breathe the trailer, which resulted in spill of approximately 5 gallons.

item.title: Report E-2023120170
item.description:
Report E-2023120170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: FORT PIERCE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS PROPANE, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Transport driver was loading his truck at Lane 2 at our Pompano Beach Terminal and there was a third party attempting to load at lane 1. The third party was having trouble and asked for help. Our transport driver continued to allow his truck to load, but failed to remain in attendance when he went to help the third party load at lane 1. When our transport driver got back to his truck, he noted that it the gauge read 95%, but he proceeded to fill out his paperwork and headed to Ft. Pierce to unload the propane rather than unloading what he had overfilled back into storage down to the AmeriGas required 85%. When our transport driver arrived in Ft. Pierce at 11:45am, he went to look for a service technician for help on what valves to open. As they walked back to the area that his truck was at (roughly 12:00pm), the pressure relief valves activated to release built up pressure - the gauge at this time was reading well over 95% due to expansion and the ground being a unlevel. Our transport driver states that the release lasted for roughly 5 minutes, but that he was able to unload his transport when it stopped leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023120181
item.description:
Report X-2023120181

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was at the station for several days but did not go out for delivery. It was discovered wet at one of the van lines and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: Both bottles of of Paramount super concentrated machine dish wash leaked from loose caps causing the shipping box to get wet. About 20 ounces were released. The shipper did not use any padding or inner packaging materials. Caps were not secured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.
